<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Geopolitics: </strong></span><span>Secretary of State Mike Pompeo told Congress yesterday that Hong Kong was </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/27/pompeo-declares-hong-kong-no-longer-autonomous-from-china.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">no longer autonomous</a></span><span> from China. “It is now clear that China is modeling Hong Kong after itself,” Pompeo said, which could have severe consequences for HK's economic relationship with the U.S.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">COVID-19: </strong></span><span>An unimaginable </span><span><a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/health/2020/05/27/coronavirus-updates-100-000-deaths-cdc-surface-spread-brazil/5263058002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">100,000 people in the U.S.</a></span><span> have now died from the coronavirus in just a few months. A new poll showed that about half of Americans aren't sure whether they'd get a vaccine if one became available. </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JOBS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/27/unemployment-young-people-teens-reach-record-highs?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You Might Have to Guard Your Own Life This Summer
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Empty lifeguard chair" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTUwL2VtcHR5X2xpZmVndWFyZF9jaGFpci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks to COVID-19, millions of young people are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/summer-jobs-dry-up-and-teens-face-highest-unemployment-in-decades-11590312600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">missing out</a> on early job experiences. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>U.S. unemployment for ages 16–19 hit 32% in April, the highest since at least 1948, per the Bureau of Labor Statistics. And it’s expected to keep climbing as more academic years end and employers say, "Do I look like I can afford interns right now?" </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Globally, over one-sixth of young workers have stopped working during the pandemic, according to the International Labor Organization (ILO), the UN’s labor arm. A new ILO report released yesterday </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/f6dff9b9440df7888b7baab03a1fb51b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">found that</a></span><span> the equivalent of 305 million full-time jobs have been lost in Q2. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">(Part of) the reason?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The industries that usually employ young people—retail, restaurants, and recreation like pools and golf courses—are exactly the ones being battered by lockdowns.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">To look on the bright side: </strong>One restaurant company owner told the WSJ he planned to hire extra workers to staff a pivot to delivery. But applicants had better get their doorbell etiquette pitch-perfect: The competition for those positions will be intense. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">To go back to the dark side</strong>: This means a big chunk of lost income for working families and for young people who may need it to cover tuition and other expenses. Plus, ILO Director-General Guy Ryder warned there is a “danger of long-term exclusion”—missing out on training and résumé-building experience could thwart or delay entire careers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I don’t think it is giving way to hyperbole to talk about the danger of a lock-down generation,” Ryder said. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This is a screeching-brake slowdown after a historic acceleration. Last July, U.S. youth unemployment <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/summer-youth-unemployment-rate-falls-to-half-century-low-11565975335?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell</a> to 9.1%, the lowest level since July 1966. That mirrored a humming labor market, in which unemployment hit 3.5% as recently as February. It's now at 14.7%. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/27/european-commission-debuts-2-trillion-recovery-package?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
EU Recovery Plan: A Lot on the Rhine
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="EU flags" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNjgvZXVfZmxhZ3MuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the European Commission (the EU’s executive body) <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/european-union-sets-out-major-coronavirus-recovery-plan-11590579779?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">proposed</a> a $2+ trillion bailout for suffering member countries. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details:</strong> The package includes an $824 billion recovery plan, plus a $1.2 trillion budget for the next seven years. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It would also tie member states’ finances together more than ever by issuing common debt.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The European Central Bank has been nagging the EU to match its super-accommodative monetary policy with meaty fiscal contributions. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The conflict: </strong>A group of northern European countries (Sweden, the Netherlands, Denmark, and Austria) dubbed the “frugal four” are spooked by the prospect of handing out support to indebted, tourism-dependent southern European countries. That tension between the wealthy north and struggling south has been a stumbling block for decades. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>all EU countries have to approve the recovery plan, so don’t expect this to wrap up anytime soon. The likely sticking points are 1) the split between grants and loans and 2) attached strings.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Papa John’s </strong>announced yesterday that North American same-store sales <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/coronavirus-covid-papa-johns-dominos-pizza-sales-are-soaring-162811309.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged 33.5%</a> during May, topping April’s 26.9% jump. “For the second straight month,” CEO Rob Lynch said, “team members and franchisees delivered the best sales period in the company’s history.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Domino’s </strong>said same-store sales over the first two months of the quarter <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/26/dominos-us-same-store-sales-rose-14percent-in-first-two-months-of-the-quarter.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased 14%</a>. But it’s not sure how long this kind of breakneck growth will last.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Don't really have any insightful takeaways here except that people are lazy and like to order cheap pizza when they have nothing else to do.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/27/instagram-rolls-new-features-allow-creators-monetize-followings?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Kylie Jenner Is About to Get a Whole Lot Richer
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Instagram announced it is <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/05/27/instagram-to-test-new-revenue-streams-including-badges-and-igtv-ads/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testing new features</a> that make it easier for creators to monetize their followings. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The features </h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>After years of </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/4/4/18293981/instagram-igtv-influencer-stars-talent-scouting-justin-antony?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">whispers</a></span><span>, Insta will start running ads before IGTV vids and sharing that revenue with creators.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Viewers will also be offered the option to purchase “badges” on Instagram Live to show their support. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it’s good for Kylie:</strong> Before these updates, the only way influencers could make money on Instagram was by inking promotional deals with brands outside the Insta ecosystem. There was no way to directly monetize their content in the vein of YouTube’s <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/7/11/20690295/youtube-vidcon-2019-monetization-features-super-stickers?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rev sharing system</a>. Now there is. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it’s good for Zuck:</strong> Influencers were already making money without Insta’s help by asking supporters for Venmos or promoting their <a href="https://www.thestreet.com/lifestyle/what-is-patreon-14865916?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Patreon</a> accounts. Now that the Facebook subsidiary is providing support on top of Lo-Fi filters, it gets to snag a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/27/21271009/instagram-ads-igtv-live-badges-test-update-creators?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">portion of that commerce</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With views of Instagram Live videos <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-05-27/instagram-will-help-its-stars-make-more-money-taking-on-youtube?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumping 70%</a> from February to March, Zuck couldn’t have timed the rollout any better.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/27/sports-teams-find-innovative-uses-stadiums?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Stadiums Adjust to Empty Nester Life
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Field hospital at stadium" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTUyL2ZpZWxkX2hvc3BpdGFsX2F0X3N0YWRpdW0uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Miguel Schincariol/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While the Tampa Bay Rays are used to empty seats, other sports organizations are looking for ways to adapt to life without...pretty much any activity. Here’s how some teams have put their stadium infrastructure to good use: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Coronavirus test sites:</strong> In April, Baltimore's Pimlico Race Track <a href="https://www.baltimoresun.com/coronavirus/bs-md-pimlico-coronavirus-testing-20200409-voapiznqy5h5rgcdybewymqwny-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hosted</a> the city's first drive-thru testing center. On Tuesday, Dodger Stadium <a href="https://www.nbclosangeles.com/news/coronavirus/dodger-stadium-coronavirus-teseting-sean-penn-covid-19-los-angeles/2368474/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opened</a> a coronavirus testing site in its vast parking area—it's now the biggest testing site in LA County. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Dodger Stadium parking lot is also being used to store fleets of rental cars no one is using.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Impromptu hospitals:</strong> A stadium in São Paulo that is typically home to four of Brazil's top-tier soccer clubs was converted into a <a href="https://www.nationalgeographic.com/history/2020/05/sports-stadiums-transformed-help-pandemic-relief-efforts/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">field hospital</a>, treating coronavirus patients in the hard-hit country. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Food distribution centers:</strong> The Chicago Cubs turned the iconic concourses at Wrigley Field into a satellite distribution center to assist a local food charity. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Drive-in movie theater:</strong> This week, the Miami Dolphins announced their Hard Rock Stadium will become an outdoor movie theater capable of holding <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2020/05/26/dolphins-unveil-plan-turn-hard-rock-stadium-into-drive-in-theater/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">230 vehicles</a>. It’ll offer fans more entertainment in one night than they’ve received in the last 10 years. </p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For today’s trivia section, we’ll give you the details on a property for sale and you have to guess the listing price (thanks <a href="https://www.axios.com/newsletters/axios-am-aefd2173-aef8-44f4-bc48-293d012fd9bc.html?chunk=9&utm_term=emshare#story9&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mike Allen</a> for the introduction). The specs: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gated estate on four acres in Potomac, Maryland</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>7 bedrooms/8 baths in the main house, 2 bed/1 bath in the guest house, and a pool house with a full kitchen and bath</span></li>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nJOBS \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThanks to COVID-19, millions of young people are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/summer-jobs-dry-up-and-teens-face-highest-unemployment-in-decades-11590312600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emissing out\u003c/a\u003e on early job experiences. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eU.S. unemployment for ages 16–19 hit 32% in April, the highest since at least 1948, per the Bureau of Labor Statistics. And it’s expected to keep climbing as more academic years end and employers say, \"Do I look like I can afford interns right now?\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eGlobally, over one-sixth of young workers have stopped working during the pandemic, according to the International Labor Organization (ILO), the UN’s labor arm. A new ILO report released yesterday \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/f6dff9b9440df7888b7baab03a1fb51b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efound that\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the equivalent of 305 million full-time jobs have been lost in Q2. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e(Part of) the reason?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe industries that usually employ young people—retail, restaurants, and recreation like pools and golf courses—are exactly the ones being battered by lockdowns.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTo look on the bright side: \u003c/strong\u003eOne restaurant company owner told the WSJ he planned to hire extra workers to staff a pivot to delivery. But applicants had better get their doorbell etiquette pitch-perfect: The competition for those positions will be intense. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTo go back to the dark side\u003c/strong\u003e: This means a big chunk of lost income for working families and for young people who may need it to cover tuition and other expenses. Plus, ILO Director-General Guy Ryder warned there is a “danger of long-term exclusion”—missing out on training and résumé-building experience could thwart or delay entire careers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“I don’t think it is giving way to hyperbole to talk about the danger of a lock-down generation,” Ryder said. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis is a screeching-brake slowdown after a historic acceleration. Last July, U.S. youth unemployment \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/summer-youth-unemployment-rate-falls-to-half-century-low-11565975335?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell\u003c/a\u003e to 9.1%, the lowest level since July 1966. That mirrored a humming labor market, in which unemployment hit 3.5% as recently as February. It's now at 14.7%. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the European Commission (the EU’s executive body) \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/european-union-sets-out-major-coronavirus-recovery-plan-11590579779?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproposed\u003c/a\u003e a $2+ trillion bailout for suffering member countries. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details:\u003c/strong\u003e The package includes an $824 billion recovery plan, plus a $1.2 trillion budget for the next seven years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt would also tie member states’ finances together more than ever by issuing common debt.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe European Central Bank has been nagging the EU to match its super-accommodative monetary policy with meaty fiscal contributions. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe conflict: \u003c/strong\u003eA group of northern European countries (Sweden, the Netherlands, Denmark, and Austria) dubbed the “frugal four” are spooked by the prospect of handing out support to indebted, tourism-dependent southern European countries. That tension between the wealthy north and struggling south has been a stumbling block for decades. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eall EU countries have to approve the recovery plan, so don’t expect this to wrap up anytime soon. The likely sticking points are 1) the split between grants and loans and 2) attached strings.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" other sports organizations are looking for ways to adapt to life without...pretty much any activity. Here’s how some teams have put their stadium infrastructure to good use: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCoronavirus test sites:\u003c/strong\u003e In April, Baltimore's Pimlico Race Track \u003ca href=\"https://www.baltimoresun.com/coronavirus/bs-md-pimlico-coronavirus-testing-20200409-voapiznqy5h5rgcdybewymqwny-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehosted\u003c/a\u003e the city's first drive-thru testing center. On Tuesday, Dodger Stadium \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbclosangeles.com/news/coronavirus/dodger-stadium-coronavirus-teseting-sean-penn-covid-19-los-angeles/2368474/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopened\u003c/a\u003e a coronavirus testing site in its vast parking area—it's now the biggest testing site in LA County. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Dodger Stadium parking lot is also being used to store fleets of rental cars no one is using.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eImpromptu hospitals:\u003c/strong\u003e A stadium in São Paulo that is typically home to four of Brazil's top-tier soccer clubs was converted into a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nationalgeographic.com/history/2020/05/sports-stadiums-transformed-help-pandemic-relief-efforts/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efield hospital\u003c/a\u003e, treating coronavirus patients in the hard-hit country. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFood distribution centers:\u003c/strong\u003e The Chicago Cubs turned the iconic concourses at href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2020/05/26/dolphins-unveil-plan-turn-hard-rock-stadium-into-drive-in-theater/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e230 vehicles\u003c/a\u003e.
